instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 randomly turning off
threads.message: This 820-3437 turns on but also off again after a few seconds. I tested the board outside the case and same thing. after it turned itshelf off i can turn it back on without any problems. Sometines it turns off during RTC-reset and sometimes it stays on for a few seconds. But it never made it to an OS. I cant see any obvious damage except some scratches between D7005 and R7005/06. I guess that somebody slipped while screwing in the AP screw (picture attched - also the antenna cables were not routed correctly). I checked everything in that area aswell as PPBUS and battery currens sensing but everything is fine... It came direct from apple ant they replacetdb the topcase and battery for some reason... That took forever and the customer wont wait any longer and also wont pay for more unnecessary fixes... Is there any hope fotr this one or is it just a waste of time?

threads.title: 820-3437 randomly turning off
threads.message:
Post basic voltages and check which are stable.
Also try to start in SMC bypass.

threads.title: 820-3437 randomly turning off
threads.message:
All S5 and G3H Voltages are present and stable. And i can turn it back on instantly. SMC Bypass did not help aswell. 
Everything seems to be stable if the board is powered. When turning off every s4 and above rail turn off (as expected)

threads.title: 820-3437 randomly turning off
threads.message:
This board should make two start attempts and stays on in the third one.
Try new BIOS.

threads.title: 820-3437 randomly turning off
threads.message: New bios also did not help
